materials_name: photographic paper steel (alloy) magnets mixed media
physical_appearance: The image shows an installation. It is rectangular in shape. The background of the installation is black in colour. There are numerous bright specks scattered throughout the entire installation. The installation resembles stars in a dark sky.
sgcool_label_text: Invisible Force reproduces part of the starry sky as photographed by NASA, strictly in accordance with the location and the size of the stars, by using nearly 30,000 industrial magnets that weigh almost two tonnes. Through the use of magnets, the work ingeniously represents the invisible gravitational forces between the celestial bodies.
subject_terms_1: sky stars (extraterrestial bodies) celestial space (astronomical concept) force (mechanical concept) mixed media works
subject_terms_2: Installations (Art) Constellations Stars Force and energy Derivative works
techniques_name: creating (artistic activity) photographic processes metalworking forming (physical activity)
